item.text: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon, she came to challenge him with difficult questions. She arrived in Jerusalem with a great display of pomp, bringing with her camels carrying spices, a very large quantity of gold, and precious gems. She visited Solomon and discussed with him everything that was on her mind.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">answered</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="01697" class="">questions</st>; there was <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">question</st> <st data-num="05956" class="">too complex</st> for the <st data-num="08010 0834 03808 05046">king</st>.<n id="1" />

When the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> of <st data-num="07614" class="">Sheba</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> for herself <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon’s</st> <st data-num="02451" class="">wisdom,</st> the <st data-num="01004 0834">palace</st><n id="1" /> he had <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st>,
the food in his banquet hall, his servants and attendants in their robes, his cupbearers in their robes, and his burnt sacrifices which he presented in the Lord’s temple, she was amazed.

She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, “The <st data-num="01697 0834">report</st> I <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> in my own <st data-num="0776" class="">country</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> your wise <st data-num="01697" class="">sayings</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="02451" class="">insight</st><n id="1" /> was <st data-num="0571" class="">true</st>!

I did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0539" class="">believe</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">these things</st> <st data-num="05704 0834">until</st> I <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> them with my own <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st>. <st data-num="02009" class="">Indeed</st>, I <st data-num="03808" class="">didn’t</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">hear</st> even <st data-num="02677" class="">half</st> the <st data-num="04768" class="">story</st>!<n id="1" /> Your <st data-num="02451" class="">wisdom</st> <st data-num="03254 05921">surpasses</st> <st data-num="08052 0834">what</st> was <st data-num="08085" class="">reported</st> to me.

Your <st data-num="0376 05650 0428">attendants</st>, who <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> you <st data-num="08548" class="">at all times</st> and <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st> your <st data-num="02451" class="">wise sayings</st>, are <st data-num="0835" class="">truly</st> <st data-num="0835" class="">happy</st>!<n id="1" />

May the Lord your God be praised because he favored you by placing you on his throne as the one ruling on his behalf. Because of your God’s love for Israel and his lasting commitment to them, he made you king over them so you could make just and right decisions.”

She <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03967 06242">120</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> and a <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07230" class="">large quantity</st> of <st data-num="01314" class="">spices</st> and <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">gems</st>. The <st data-num="01931" class="">quantity</st> of <st data-num="01314 0834">spices</st> the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> of <st data-num="07614" class="">Sheba</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> has <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> matched.<n id="2" />

(<st data-num="02361" class="">Huram’s</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571 05650">servants</st>, aided by <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon’s</st> <st data-num="05650 0834">servants</st>, <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> from <st data-num="0211" class="">Ophir</st>, <st data-num="0935" class="">as well as</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0418" class="">fine</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="06086" class="">timber</st> and <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">gems</st>.
With the timber the king made steps for the Lord’s temple and royal palace as well as stringed instruments for the musicians. No one had seen anything like them in the land of Judah before that.)
King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she requested, more than what she had brought him. Then she left and returned to her homeland with her attendants.
Solomon received 666 talents of gold per year,

<st data-num="0905" class="">besides</st> what he <st data-num="0935" class="">collected</st> from the <st data-num="0376 08446">merchants</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05503" class="">traders</st>. <st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="06152" class="">Arabian</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> and the <st data-num="06346" class="">governors</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> also <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> and <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> to <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st>.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="06793" class="">large shields</st> of <st data-num="07820" class="">hammered</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>; <st data-num="08337 03967">600</st> measures<n id="1" /> of <st data-num="07820" class="">hammered</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> were <st data-num="05927" class="">used</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">each</st> <st data-num="06793" class="">shield</st>.
He also made 300 small shields of hammered gold; 300 measures of gold were used for each of those shields. The king placed them in the Palace of the Lebanon Forest.
The king made a large throne decorated with ivory and overlaid it with pure gold.

There were <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="04609" class="">steps</st> leading up to the <st data-num="03678" class="">throne</st>, and a <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="03534" class="">footstool</st> was <st data-num="0270" class="">attached</st> to the <st data-num="03678" class="">throne</st>.<n id="1" /> The throne had <st data-num="02088 02088">two</st> <st data-num="03027 05921 04725 03427">armrests</st> with <st data-num="08147" class="">a</st> statue of a <st data-num="0738" class="">lion</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="0681" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">each side</st>.<n id="2" />
There were twelve statues of lions on the six steps, one lion at each end of each step. There was nothing like it in any other kingdom.

All of King Solomon’s cups were made of gold, and all the household items in the Palace of the Lebanon Forest were made of pure gold. There were no silver items, for silver was not considered very valuable in Solomon’s time.
The king had a fleet of large merchant ships manned by Huram’s men that sailed the sea. Once every three years the fleet came into port with cargoes of gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
King Solomon was wealthier and wiser than any of the kings of the earth.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="01245" class="">wanted</st> to <st data-num="06440" class="">visit</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> to <st data-num="08085" class="">see</st> him <st data-num="08085" class="">display</st> his <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>-<st data-num="05414 03820">given</st> <st data-num="02451 0834">wisdom</st>.<n id="1" />
Year after year visitors brought their gifts, which included items of silver, items of gold, clothes, perfume, spices, horses, and mules.
Solomon had 4,000 stalls for his chariot horses and 12,000 horses. He kept them in assigned cities and also with him in Jerusalem.

He <st data-num="01961 04910">ruled</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">kingdoms</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the Euphrates <st data-num="05104" class="">River</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> as plentiful<n id="1" /> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> as <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>; <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">was</st><n id="2" /> as <st data-num="07230" class="">plentiful</st> as <st data-num="08256 0834">sycamore fig trees</st> are in the <st data-num="08219" class="">foothills</st>.<n id="3" />
Solomon acquired horses from Egypt and from all the lands.

The rest of the events of Solomon’s reign, from start to finish, are recorded in the Annals of Nathan the Prophet, the Prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and the Vision of Iddo the Seer pertaining to Jeroboam son of Nebat.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="04427" class="">ruled</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> from <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="1" /> for <st data-num="0705" class="">forty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>.
Then Solomon passed away and was buried in the city of his father David. His son Rehoboam replaced him as king.
